trans-unit.source: Provides a text-based control that allows the user to enter text.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The TextBox allows only single-line text input.
This control also implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface; it can accept input and generate postbacks.
With devices using WML, however, entered data might not post back to the server.

When the user enters values in a text box, the values are stored in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property, which is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> base class.
> [!NOTE] > A TextBox accepts user input, which is a potential security threat.
By default, ASP.NET Mobile Web Forms pages validate that user input does not include script or HTML elements.
For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Loads postback data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox"></xref> control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The LoadPostData method first attempts to call the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> object referenced by <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Adapter%2A>.

If the adapter has no device-specific implementation for loading the post data into the control, that call returns `false` and the LoadPostData method then tests the value of the object referenced by the `data` parameter at the specified `key` against <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A>.
If the values are not equal, the new value is set.

If either attempt to load the posted data, whether through the adapter or directly, results in the data being changed, a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> will occur.
The key of the value in the `data` collection to be used for this control.
The collection of name/value pairs posted to the server.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox"></xref> control's state has changed as a result of the postback; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the maximum number of characters allowed in the text box.
The default value is 0, meaning that there is no limit on the length.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The maximum number of characters allowed in the text box.
The value is less than zero.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the input must be fully numeric.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Not all markup languages support the use of fully numeric user input.
For example, HTML does not support this property.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the input must be fully numeric; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called when the user changes the text in the text box and the changes are submitted to the server.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox.TextChanged> event.
Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks when the text is changed.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains event data.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the input must be treated as a password and the characters masked on the target device.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An asterisk is a typical character that is used to mask a password.
> [!NOTE] > Setting the Password property to true does not encrypt or otherwise protect the password string during transmission.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the input must be treated as a password; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox"></xref> control that the postback data has changed.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The RaisePostDataChangedEvent method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox.OnTextChanged%2A> method with <xref:System.EventArgs.Empty> as the event arguments.
Gets or sets the expected length of the specified text box, in characters.
The default value for the size of a text box is 0, which means that the browser will use its default text box length.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This information is not used to perform validation checks against the actual input value.
To perform a validation check against an input value, use the validator controls or the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox.MaxLength%2A> property.
This information does determine the rendering behavior.
For example, the value of this property helps determine how large to make an input text box in HTML.
The expected length of the specified text box, in characters.
The value is less than zero.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
The key of the value in the `Data` collection to be used for this control.
The collection of name/value pairs posted to the server.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control's state has changed as a result of the postback; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
Occurs when the user changes the text of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
When the user changes the text of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox>, this event is not raised immediately.
The form must contain a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command> to initiate a postback event that raises the TextChanged event.
To be added.
Gets or sets the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Title" name="Title" href=""></xref> attribute on WML devices.
The default value is an empty string.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_Title" name="Title" href=""></xref> attribute on WML devices.
